embeds.title: Mass Repurpose
embeds.description:
Rare Skill / 1 :energy_slime: / The Slime Boss / Downfall

**Absorb** ALL Slimes. Split into a random **Specialist** for each.  **Command** them.)
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: Cute beta art
SLIMEBOSS is YOU

I used this card a lot before reformation got nerfed. Now I cannot remember the last time i've picked it. The benefit this card has is that with 3 slimes in play; it gives you 3 strength and 3 specialist slimes. The problem is that getting 3 specialist slimes at random isnt acutally very likely to give you more then 1 good slime. Needing 3 slimes in play for this card to have any value is also slightly awkward. When slime boss already has plenty of cards that can be used to absorb slimes in a more convenient way that are also on lower rarities.

I cant really say this card is bad though; its has a lot of value if you can find a deck that can acutally use it. Its just really situational; this is an act 3 card your not really going to take it very often before that point. its also worth noting that this card is substantially stronger when its upgraded since thats 3 commands your getting for just 1 energy.
if we ever get a card that offers more slime slots this cards stocks will skyrocket though
I'd consider reformation more of a rework than a nerf tbh
although maybe that's just me being nitpicky
well reformation went from a character defining card to a pretty good block common. I think that qualifies as a nerf since slime boss as a whole is worse off after that change.
holy shit conditional inflame, if you work hard enough you can get a full entire inflame
its actually incredible how completely terrible slimes are

like imagine if defrag only increased the block of your frost orbs by 0 (1) and you couldn't get more slots and you couldn't control the order of them because your coolheaded and ball lightnings exhausted and also whenever you tried to make a dark or plasma orb it rolled a dice instead and maybe you'd get a dark orb but maybe you'd also just get an orb that only attacks every other turn and imagine if when you evoked an orb you didn't get any instant value of out it and instead you got a single point stat that did not help orbs at all
slimes are so, so, bad
Interesting way to think of it tbh, I see it more as "slimes were nerfed severely (lol) but the character's consistency in draw went up"
any ideas for a rework of slimes archetype?

i like the difference between this discord and all other people who check out sts downfall

random person on reddit: you should try the downfall mod its pretty cool its got some of the best characters out there and while theyre a bit strong theyre still very fun and balanced

typical downfallcord discussion: this archetype is completely unplayable, the optimal strat is to focus only on 3 cards and try to force an infinite, everything else is terrible value. 87% a20 winrate
then again, the people here have played the characters much more
@Mwalls had some idea of infinite slime slots and multicommanding, leaning hard into the army commander angle
mass reproduce is literally just a bad card, like <sunbloom kindling> where its just so insanely conditional for a slightly better version of inflame but its rare

messages.content: sunbloom kindling is more just "who wants a shitload of firewood?"
bro your strikes and defends?
your status and curse cards?
if you're running out of things to kindle, that's good because you only have good cards left. embers make it worse to have actually good cards at the end of the day
this is the main thing that makes pyre insanely overpowered
it was designed around using embers and kindlings so you "don't run out of cards" but the fact that true grit is arguably ironclad's best common was ignored
well I never said someone would actually WANT the shitload of firewood
Maybe if collector weren't already suffering from hand bloat and had more cards that exhaust multiple cards at a time embers would be more useful. As things are they aren't really needed.

Anyway, mass repurpuse. Absolutely mediroce card, at worse it does literally nothing on play and just takes up draw space. At best it gives you some strength and slimes that range from powerful, through situational to gimmicky.
Any card that lets you pick your slimes or at least had a predefined slime asocited with it is by default better than this.

embeds.title: Acid Slime (L)
embeds.description:
Normal / 65-69 (68-72) HP / Slay the Spire

**:intent_ad: Corrosive Spit**
```ansi
[2;31m11 [2;34m(12). [0;2mShuffles [2;31m2 [2;33mSlimed [0;2minto your discard pile.
```**:intent_d: Lick**
```ansi
[0;2mApplies [2;31m2 [2;33mWeak.
```**:intent_a: Tackle**
```ansi
[2;31m16 [2;34m(18).
```**:intent_u: Split**
```ansi
[0;2mSplits into [2;31m2 [0;2mAcid Slimes (M) with its current HP.
```
30%/40%/30% (40%/30%/30% on A17) chance to use Corrosive Spit/Tackle/Lick.
When its HP is at or below 50%, switches its intent to Split.
Cannot use Tackle twice in a row or Corrosive Spit three times in a row. Cannot use Lick three times in a row (or twice in a row on A17).

messages.content: then again, Tough Bandages is actually proven to be strong enough to be considered a boss relic
mostly bc calc gamble
and discard synergy stuff
the difference is that one is renewable and doable multiple times in a turn
and the other one is split

It's quite poor. You need to already have slimes out for it to do anything, and it gives you some strength, and replaces them with randomized specialist slimes, which leaves a lot of room for things to go wrong, even if you can support this. There are a decent number of the specialist slimes that are worse then leeching and mire slime, and given that split: leeching exhausts, you really don't want to be trading those in for random slimes instead, even if you can sometimes highroll. Even worse, this is a rare, making it very expensive at shops, and in direct competition with the rest of the fairly solid slime boss rares at boss card rewards. The upgrade gives it some utility at least, with the command giving it some more frontloaded potential, but it's still highly random in it's output, and that's a huge investment of taking a rare and upgrading it, and it can still be a bad draw if you draw it before your other slimes generators. Having at least some control over what specialist slimes you get would be a major improvement, though still probably not enough to make this worth taking. Strange spoon is intriguing here as a way to not exhaust your common split cards, and possibly even replay this to stack lots of strength, but that's kind of rare/gimmicky. Sources of potency can do weird/powerful things for specialist slimes, and can also (randomly) make this better.

Without old reformation, this kind of mass absorption card doesn't really have a home (for the record, I do think it was too strong, and overcentralizing for the character, and I do really like the new common card manipulation/block). The issue is that now a card like this, and other ways to make/absorb slimes don't really have a particularly strong reason to be taken, there's no major payoff or incentive, especially since slime boss doesn't really use strength well considering that goop does a similar job, has many more synergies, and that slim boss has only one multihit to benefit from strength.

ngl I see a lot of people giving old reformation more credit than it deserves. It was overpowered but I would never have considered it overcentralizing. It's a rare power that *requires* an upgrade, and then it still gives a finite amount of strength/dex upon playing split cards, which aren't that strong considering they're supposed to be damage cards yet activate nob's enrage, bird cultist guy's hex, and doesn't scale with strength (something you would've had an abundance of)

You rarely take more than 2 splits (usually just a mire or leeching) UNTIL you get reformation, as the opportunity cost of adding a bunch of splits to your deck hurts, and if you don't get reformation you basically lose act 4.

Compared to much more consistent and much more overcentralizing strategies that slime boss has (that were even stronger back when reformation existed) I don't think it was that strong, it just had a pretty high ceiling and was fun to use.

I do think it wasn't a healthy card for the character and I think the rework adds a lot of consistency to the early game for slime boss, but until lick recursion and growth punch is nerfed I feel like most of slime boss' kit is a bit pointless.
Slimbo has a similar problem to watcher. Has some cool stuff but one build that is way too strong that completely outperforms the rest of the cards.

Overcentralizing may have been the wrong word. I would reclarify that it was too central of a payoff for specifically slime summoning/absorbption. In the same way that high noon takes up a very large part of the power budget of hermit's strike/defend package. Old absorption was such a key payoff for summoning slimes that it didn't leave much room for other payoffs to be as prominent/powerful, and now that it's gone, there isn't a very good reason left to take cards like mass repurpose that allow you to trigger absorption multiple times. Slime boss would probably benefit from having stronger incentives to take the slime summoning and absorption cards now that old reform is gone.
Okay yes that I totally agree with
